intro: Senecio phelpsiae, commonly known as Phelps' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are generally grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
